body.p:
To His Excellency
Thos. E Bramlett
Governor Ky

Your Petitioners citizens of Lawrence County Kentucky would respectfully ask your Excellency to remit a fine which was at the last Term of our Lawrce Circuit Court inflicted upon George Martin on a charge of Keeping a Tipling House The fine was for Sixty Dollars and Mr Martin Court pay it He is now and and has been for months past confined to his Bed from a case of chronic sore eys. He is consequently unable to even support a large Family he has. This is his first offense & we humbly ask that you interpose in his behalf believing it will be his first & last violation He is now & has been a strong and active Union man Grant this and we will ever pray &c

R. f. Vinson C L C C
D. W. Johns
J W Haws P J L C
John M Reid
Geo W Harbinson
Jno. B. Maynard
J. B. Huchinson
John Pigg
Wm M R Jones
D C Jones
Fleming McHenry
Jas. M Frazier
Jno. B. Hatcher
Chas. N. Prichard
Henry R Stuart
Andrew C. York
Stephen McMarcum Esqr
William A. Holt
Washington Ratcliff
David C Damron
Miles. R. Drumond
D C Oroark
A W Murry
J. W. Shannon
Thomas Caines
Thomas Pigg

I K F Prichard Notary Public in and for the County and state above named do Certify that the above Signed Petitioners who have Signed their names to the foregoing Petition of George Martin are citizens of Lawrence County Kentucky That they or a majority of them are respectable and honorable citizens of Lawrence County Kentucky and that their Signatures hereto annexed is general

NOTARY

body.p: In testimony whereof I have hereunto Signed my name and affixed my official seal Done at Louisa Ky This 26 day of March 1864
K F Prichard N. P. L. C
